result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Calvin L Taylor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Calvin L Taylor was found guilty of Battery AMENDED FROM Physicial abuse of child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Calvin L Taylor was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Calvin L Taylor was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Calvin L Taylor was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.

Provide DNA sample and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with current treatment program; meeting with counseling, taking prescribed medications and other requirements.  Comply with child support and Family Court orders.  No contact with named victim, T.M.H.  May have contact with son provide agent consents and there is a Family Court order outlining the custody arrangment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

**10/29/2015 BTC: Bond modified to lift house arrest. Must reside at the home of his parents and abide by there rules, including curfew, may obtain employment, continue treatment, enroll in school and must continue treatment.
CO-SIGNED BY BOTH PARENTS - RONALD AND LABRENDA HOPGOOD W/PHOTO I.D. 
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, TMH and CLJ (person, property, residence or family).    Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
08/25/2015 - BOND AMENDED - House arrest at home of parents. May leave for court, treatment programming including Roger's Hospital (in or out-patient), and if with parents. Defendant may only be released from jail to parents.
